responsibilities: Develop and improve the current data architecture, data quality, monitoring, and data availability.
Collaborate with Data Scientists to implement advanced analytics algorithms for statistical analysis, prediction, clustering, and machine learning.
Partner with Business Analysts across teams to build and verify hypotheses to improve the AWS Support business.
Help continually improve ongoing reporting and analysis processes, simplifying self-service support for customers.
Keep up to date with advances in big data technologies and run pilots to design the data architecture to scale with increased data sets of customer experience on AWS.
qualifications: Experience with data modeling, warehousing, and building ETL pipelines
Proficiency in one or more query languages (e.g., SQL, PL/SQL, DDL, MDX, HiveQL, SparkSQL, Scala)
Proficiency in one or more scripting languages (e.g., Python, KornShell)
analysis:
The job responsibilities focus on developing and improving data architecture, collaborating with data scientists for advanced analytics, partnering with business analysts, and improving reporting and analysis processes. The skills required include data engineering, business acumen, problem-solving, data collection and analysis, data modeling, warehousing, building ETL pipelines, and proficiency in query and scripting languages.

There is no mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is primarily on data engineering, analytics, and improving data processes, which are not directly related to GenAI or LLMs. The job seems to be more about handling and processing large datasets and implementing analytics algorithms rather than developing or working with language models or generative AI technologies.
